title: Medical Definition of Allopathic medicine
author: Medical Editor Melissa Conrad Stöppler; MD
description: Read medical definition of Allopathic medicine
cleaned_text: is also termed [Western medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33616), [evidence-based medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33300), or modern medicine. The term was coined [in](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3950) 1810 by Samuel Hahnemann (1755-1843) to designate the usual practice of medicine (allopathy) as opposed to homeopathy, the system of [therapy](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10897) that he founded. Homeopathy is based on the concept that [disease](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3011) can be treated with minute doses of drugs thought capable of producing the same symptoms in [healthy](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=39755) people as the disease itself. Although [allopathic](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33613) medicine" was rejected by mainstream physicians, it was adopted by [alternative medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=2211) advocates
